bachelor: Does the interviewer know what your bachelor's degree is?
Have you told the recruiter about your bachelor course?
If I asked the interviewer what area you studied, would he or she know the answer?
Has the recruiter been informed about the field of your bachelor?
Does the interviewer know what you have studied in your bachelor?
industry-experience: Does the recruiter know about the years of your industry experience?
Have you told the interviewer about the years of your experience in the industry?
Has the interviewer been informed about your time of industry experience?
Does the recruiter already know how long you have worked in the industry?
If I asked the recruiter how long you have been working in the industry, would he or she know the answer?
highest-education: Have you informed the recruiter about your highest academic degree?
Does the interviewer know your level of education?
Do you think the recruiter knows your latest academic level?
Is the interviewer aware of your highest education level?
Have you informed the recruiter about your latest academic degree?
other-skills: Have you informed the interviewer about your other skills?
Does the recruiter know your additional skills?
Do you think the recruiter knows what other skills you have?
Is the recruiter aware of your other skills?
Have you told the interviewer about your extra skills?
availability: Does the recruiter know when you can start?
Have you told the interviewer when you want to start?
Has the recruiter been informed about your availability?
Does the interviewer already know your preferred starting date?
If I asked the interviewer when you are able to start working, would he or she know the answer?
Have you informed the interviewer about your dates?
Do you think the recruiter knows when you want to start?
